ipxact:register.ipxact:name: VPU_VINT_REASON_CLR
ipxact:register.ipxact:description:
Interrupt Reason Clear
This register clears the interrupt reason in ISR when host processor catchs an interrupt. It is to notify that host processor has received the interrupt. If host processor wants to get task done interrupts or so from VPU, they should set the fields of VPU_VINT_ENABLE register as they wish. And when they recieve any of the command done interrupt from VPU (VPU_VINT_REASON_CLR is not zero), host processor should check the interrupt and do the following sequence for safe interrupt clear.
1. Clear the interrupt by setting the relevant bit of this VPU_VINT_REASON_CLR. 2. Set VPU_VINT_CLEAR to 1, which drops the interrupt signal. Then VPU_VPU_INT_STS is automatically cleared.
In above sequence, 1 should be done first than 2 because VPU_VINT_CLEAR without VPU_VINT_REASON_CLR leads to interrupt reassurtion.

ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Bitstream empty (bitstream feeding request) interrupt clear

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: VPU_VINT_CLEAR
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Clear VPU interrupt. Host processor can clear the VPU interrupt which has been pending through this register. As mentioned in VPU_VINT_REASON_CLR, this register setting definetely come after VPU_INT_REASON setting. Also, setting this VPU_VINT_CLEAR to 1 forces VPU_VPU_INT_STS INT_STS to be cleared automatically.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: VPU_HINT_CLEAR
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Check Host Command Interrupt is cleared. From host side, this register is not used or checked. VPU can clear the host interrupt which has been pending through this register. When VPU operation for the host interrupt is done, VPU sets this reigster to clear the host interrupt.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: VPU_REMAP_CTRL
ipxact:register.ipxact:description:
Remap control register (REMAP REG ADDR / ATTR / SIZE)
VPU remaps addresses VCPU uses between the physical memory and virtual memory for efficient address management. VPU works with the virtual memory addresses that are translated to the phsyical addresses. Host processor needs to assign V-CPU code buffer to VPU_REMAP_PADDR and VPU_REMAP_VADDR to 0, so that VPU can start by reading from VPU_REMAP_PADDR considering it is its the base address 0. This register has the configuration fields for remapping.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: REMAP_GLOBEN
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set 1 if you want to change the [30:12] part of this register Default to be 0

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RSVD0
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ENDIAN
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Endianness for memory access Endian control of memory transactions from processor core

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: REMAP_IDX
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Remap index Only 0 to 3 are valid.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: REMAP_PAGE_SIZE_EN
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set 1 if you want to change the REMAP_PSIZE field Default to be 0

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RSVD1
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: REMAP_PSIZE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Remap Page Size (page base should be aligned in 4KB boundary) 0x001: 4K 0x002: 8K 0x004: 16K 0x008: 32K 0x010 : 64K 0x020 : 128K 0x040 : 256K 0x080: 512K 0x100: 1M

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: VPU_REMAP_VADDR
ipxact:register.ipxact:description:
Remap region base address in virtual address space Virtual address space is an address generated by V-CPU.
To setup Remap region, keep the sequence below. # set remap index using REMAP_IDX in VPU_REMAP_CTRL. While setting up, other information should be the same as the previous value # set virtual address using VPU_REMAP_VADDR # set physical address using VPU_REMAP_PADDR
CAUTION: In case of CODE section (which has REMAP IDX 0), virtual address should be 0x0, since V-CPU always start booting up from virtual address 0. If not, VPU can not boot-up.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VPU_REMAP_VADDR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Remap region base address in virtual address space. The address should be aligned to 4KB boundary.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: VPU_REMAP_PADDR
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Remap region base address in physical address space

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VPU_REMAP_PADDR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Real address(physical address) as a pair of virtual address. It should aligned to 4KB boundary.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VPU_REMAP_CORE_START
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: It starts VPU after initial setting has been done. After setting up remap or initial configuartion, host should set this register to init VPU.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VPU_BUSY_STATUS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
Command Reentrance Check [0]
0: Host processor has the ownership for access to host interface. 1: VPU has the ownership for access to host interface.
- host should set this flag just before trying to send a command into command-queue - firmware clears this flag when a command is queueued for processing. - for the case of clock_gating or power_down, please use VPU_VCPU_STATUS register to check the status of VPU.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: VPU_HALT_STATUS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: For power control, status checking of V-CPU

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VPU_HALT_STATUS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: 1: V-CPU is on the HALT status

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VPU_HALT_STATUS_DEBUG
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: for debugging - Eventhough V-CPU is on HALT status, for the clock gating or power down, VPU_VCPU_STATUS should be checked to check pending bus operations.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: VPU_VCPU_STATUS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: V-CPU bus busy and V-CPU status

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VPU_VCPU_STATUS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If [31:16] is 0x0000, there is no more bus transaction on V-CPU. If [15:0] is 0x0040, V-CPU is on the halt status. Thus, the value returns 0x40, power for VPU can be turnned-off

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VPU_BUSY_STATUS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: 0 : VPU is idle. Host processor can gate the clock of VPU. 1 : VPU is busy.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: COMMAND
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Command to run VPU Depending on the value of command, host interface registers from 0x210 mean different things.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: COMMAND
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: 0x0001 : INIT_VPU 0x0004 : SLEEP_VPU 0x0008 : CREATE_INST 0x0010 : FLUSH_INST 0x0020 : DESTROY_INST 0x0040 : INIT_SEQ 0x0080 : SET_FB 0x0100 : ENC_PIC / DEC_PIC 0x0200 : ENC_SET_PARAM 0x4000 : GET_VPU_INFO 0x8000 : UPDATE_BS

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RSVD0
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FORCE_FILM_GRAIN_OFF
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: AV1 DEC only 0x0: film grain is not applied to BWB output regardless of syntax value named "apply_grain" 0x1: film grain is applied or not to BWB output in accordance with syntax value named "apply_grain"

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SKIP_MODE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
[HEVC DEC] 0x00: normal DEC_PIC 0x10: thumbnail mode. It skips non-IRAP pictures w/o registering reference DPB. 0x11: skip non-IRAP. 0x13: skip non-reference picture. 0x20: handle CRA picture as BLA. It skips RASL pictures followd by CRA pictures.
[AVC DEC] 0x00: normal DEC_PIC 0x10: thumbnail mode. It skips non-IRAP pictures w/o registering reference DPB. 0x11: skip non-IRAP. 0x13: skip non-reference picture.
[VP9 DEC] 0x00: normal DEC_PIC 0x10: thumbnail mode. It skips non-IRAP pictures w/o registering reference DPB. 0x11: skip non-key frame.
[AV1 DEC] 0x00: normal DEC_PIC 0x10: thumbnail mode. It skips non-IRAP pictures w/o registering reference DPB. 0x11: skip non-key frame.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: INIT_SEQ_OPTION
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: 0x01: INIT_SEQ 0x11: INIT_SEQ (w/ Thumbnail mode)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RSVD0

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RSVD0

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NON_REF_FBC_WRITING

ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
Codec standard to run
STD_HEVC_DEC = 0x00 STD_HEVC_ENC = 0x01 STD_AVC_DEC = 0x02 STD_AVC_ENC = 0x03 STD_VP9_DEC = 0x16 STD_AV1_DEC = 0x1A STD_AV1_ENC = 0x1B

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: INST_INDEX
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
Instance Index
VPU can encode or decode more than one instance simultaneously. If multiple instances are running, each instance must have its own process index that is assigned by this register. For example, two instances are running simultaneously, the first instance has the process index 0, the second instance has the process index 1. Instance index shall be in the range of 0 to 31, inclusive.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CODE_BUF_SIZE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Base address of V-CPU code and V-CPU global data. End address of V-CPU stack is CMD_INIT_ADDR_CODE_BASE + CMD_INIT_CODE_SIZE. It should be aligned to 4KB range.

ipxact:alternateRegister.ipxact:name: CMD_QUE_FULL_IDC
ipxact:alternateRegister.ipxact:description: Indicator for which command queue is full. Host can can read this register at any time. Because the reading of this register does not involve interrupt to VCPU, it does not cause any VCPU performance drop.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CMD_QUEUE_FULLNESS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: For each bit position i, - '1' means the command queue for instance i is full. - '0' means the command queue for instance i is not full.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CODE_ENDIAN
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Endianness of V-CPU code and V-CPU data.

ipxact:alternateRegister.ipxact:name: RET_QUE_EMPTY_IDC
ipxact:alternateRegister.ipxact:description: Indicator for which command queue is full. Host can can read this register at any time. Because the reading of this register does not involve interrupt to VCPU, it does not cause any VCPU performance drop.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RET_QUEUE_EMPTY
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: For each bit position i, - '1' means the command queue for instance i is empty. - '0' means the command queue for instance i is not empty.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TEMP_BUF_BASE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
Base address of temporal buffer for this frame
[NOTE] Each V-CORE should set this field for its own temporal buffer.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TEMP_BUF_SIZE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Temporal buffer size for a frame

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: CMD_INIT_ADDR_SEC_AXI
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Secondary AXI base address It is valid when USE_SEC_AXI is not 0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UART_OPTION

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RD_PTR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
Start address of bitstream for handling current command Host processor cannot update this register in the middle of decoding. It is only allowed to update this before decoding has started.
VPU also updates this (RET_ADDR_BS_RD_PTR) with end address of a NAL, when a NAL is decoded.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RD_PTR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Start address of bitstream buffer (in line buffer mode only)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BS_START_ADDR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Start address of bitstream buffer (in line buffer mode only) It should be aligned in bus width (128bit/16 byte), but we highly recommend to be aligned in 4KB

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: WORK_BUF_BASE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Base address of work buffer for each instance This address should be aligned in 4KB boundary.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SET_DISP_IDC
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
Set display flag value.
VPU and Host handshake display frame buffer ownership. For example, display flag for frame buffer 0 is 1, host have ownership for the frame buffer 0 and VPU can't write any data to frame buffer 0 until host release and set 0 to display flag of frame buffer 0.
SET_DISP_IDC and CLR_DISP_IDC is used to set/clear display flag for 0~31 display frame buffer.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PVRIC_ENABLE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
This field enables VPU to generate PVRIC format of decoded frames.
0: BWB format 1: PVRIC format
[NOTE] This is valid only if PVRIC hardware is included in the product.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: AFBC_ENABLE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
This field enables VPU to generate AFBC(Arm Frame Buffer Compression) format of decoded frames.
0: BWB format 1: AFBC format
[NOTE] This is valid only if AFBC hardware is included in the product.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RSVD0
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BWB_ENABLE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
This field indicates whether target frame buffers are used for uncompressed linear frame.
0: Target frame buffers are compressed frames. 1: Target frame buffers are uncompressed linear frames.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CSC_ENABLE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
This field indicates whether to enable CSC (color space conversion) or not.
0 : disable CSC. (output: YCbCr) 1 : enable CSC. (output: RGB)
This field is valid only if BWB_ENABLE is 1. [NOTE] This is valid only if CSC hardware is included in the product.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RSVD1
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PIXEL_ORDER_MODE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
Pixel ordering in a bus word
0: decreasing ordering - pixel position is decreasing as byte address in a bus is increaing. 1: incrsing ordering - pixel position is increasing as byte address in a bus is increaing.
[NOTE] Pixel position is always increasing as word address is increasing. This field is valid only if BWB_ENABLE is 1.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PIXEL_OUTPUT_MODE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
[22] 0 : MSB justified pixel 1 : LSB justified pixel
[21:20] 0 : BWB output mode 0 (10bit/pixel -> 8bit/pixel) 1 : BWB output mode 1 (16bit/pixel) 2 : BWB output mode 2 (32bit/pixel)
PIXEL_OUTPUT_MODE cannot be 2 if Chroma Output Format (COMMON_PIC_INFO[18:16]) is set as packed mode (4~7) Valid only if BWB_ENABLE is 1.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PIXEL_FORMAT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
0 : YCbCr420 1 : YCbCr422
The default value is 0. Valid only if both BWB_ENABLE 1.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CHROMA_OUTPUT_FORMAT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
BWB Chroma format
0 : Planar mode - YV12 when YCbCr420, YV16 when YCbCr422 1 : Semi-planar mode, Cb/Cr interleaved - NV12 when YCbCr420, NV16 when YCbCr422 3 : Semi-planar mode, Cb/Cr interleaved - NV21 when YCbCr420, NV61 when YCbCr422
Valid only if BWB_ENABLE is 1.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FB_STRIDE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Stride for the storing alignment

VPU reports user data of the decoded frame if user data exists in the decoded frame and the relevant user data report option is enabled. User data buffering/reordering is required to sync user data with display frame.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BS_BUF_SIZE

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: WR_PTR

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: WORK_BUF_SIZE

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PIC_HEIGHT

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STREAM_END

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: EXPLICIT_END

ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Endianness of bitstream buffer

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STREAM_FORMAT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Bitstream format (AV1) 0 : IVF 1 : OBU 2 : ANNEXB

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STREAM_END
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This field makes VPU assume Stream End when there is no stream to feed in the buffer.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: EXPLICIT_END
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
Explicit End
When this field is set to 1, VPU assumes that bitstream buffer has at least one single frame and follows the tasks below.
# VPU decodes until the end of bitstream buffer (WR_PTR) even if the last 3 bytes are all 0. # VPU returns success if it has decoded a frame successfully. If bitstream is insufficient to complete decoding a frame, VPU performs what it is supposed to do with the specified task in BS_SHORTAGE_OPTION of BS_PARAM.
If this flag is 0,
# VPU decodes to the almost end of bitstream buffer (WR_PTR), but not to some bytes (less than 3). It intentionally does not consume some a few bytes, because VPU is not sure if the last bytes are the start code of next NAL or they might not fill the offset in the CABAC. # VPU returns success if it has decoded a frame successfully. If bitstream is insufficient to complete decoding a frame, VPU stops decoding and waits for more bitstream to be filled. Then host processor can do either feed bitstream more or set EXPLICIT_END to complete decoding anyhow.
BITSTREAM_EMPTY interrupt is asserted when EXPLITCT_END = 0 or when bitstream buffer is near empty (not real empty) for seamless decoding.
CAUTION: Host processor can set this register any time, but cannot clear during command processing.

ipxact:alternateRegister.ipxact:name: CMD_SEQ_CHANGE_ENABLE_FLAG
ipxact:alternateRegister.ipxact:description:
Sequence change enable flag
If any bit flag of SEQ_CHANGE_ENABLE_FLAG is 1 and the syntax value corresponding the bit flag is changed with a newly activated SPS, VPU regards it as sequence change.
VPU reports sequence change to RET_QUERY_DEC_NOTIFICATION register. Then VPU bumps out all of the pictures that remain in DPB and clears the reference flag. However, there is an exception. If RET_QUERY_DEC_NOTIFICATION[17] is 1, VPU only reports the DPB index to be replaced wihtin the same sequence.

(gop_size=4) 6 : I-P-P-P-P,... (consecutive P, gop_size=4) 7 : I-B-B-B-B,... (consecutive B, gop_size=4) 8 : I-B-B-B-B-B-B-B-B,... (random access, gop_size=8)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TARGET_DEC_SPATIAL_ID_PLUS1
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set an absolute target spatial ID (TARGET_DEC_SPATIAL_ID_PLUS1). (for AV1)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: DEC_TEMP_ID_MODE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
Set the mode of temporal ID selection. 0: use the target temporal_id as absolute value.
@* TARGET_DEC_TEMP_ID = TARGET_DEC_TEMP_ID_PLUS1 -1 @* When use of absolute value for temporal target, decoder can keep the decoding layer ID. If the SPS_MAX_SUB_LAYER is changed in the bitstream, the temporal skip ratio can be changed.
1: use the target temporal _id as relative value.
@* TARGET_DEC_TEMP_ID = SPS_MAX_SUB_LAYER - REL_TARGET_TEMP_ID @* SPS_MAX_SUB_LAYER is signalled from bitstream. @* When use of relatvie value, decoder can keep the skip(discard) ratio regardless the change of SPS_MAX_SUB_LAYER in the bitstream

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TARGET_DEC_TEMP_ID_PLUS1
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
If DEC_TEMP_ID_MODE is 0, this field is used as an absolute target temporal ID (TARGET_DEC_TEMP_ID_PLUS1).
@* TARGET_DEC_TEMP_ID = TARGET_DEC_TEMP_ID_PLUS1 -1. @* Based on TARGET_DEC_TEMP_ID, @** 0x0 : it decodes a picture of all ranges of temporal ID, which means temporal ID decoding constraint off. @** 0x1 ~ 0x6 : it decodes a picture if the temporal ID is less than or equal to TARGET_DEC_TEMP_ID. It discards a picture when its temporal ID is greater than TARGET_DEC_TEMP_ID.
If DEC_TEMP_ID_MODE is 1, this field is used as a relative target temporal ID (REL_TARGET_TEMP_ID).
@* TARGET_DEC_TEMP_ID = SPS_MAX_SUB_LAYER - REL_TARGET_TEMP_ID @* It discards a picture when its temporal ID is greater than TARGET_DEC_TEMP_ID.

It returns a frame rate numerator. This field is valid for H.265 and AVS2.
If frame rate syntax is not decoded in bitstream, the value of FrameRateNr is equal to -1. If FRAME_RATE_NR and FRAME_RATE_DR are not-zero values, FrameRate is derived as follows. FrameRate =FRAME_RATE_NR/FRAME_RATE_DR.
Otherwise if FRAME_RATE_NR or FRAME_RATE_DR are zero values, the value of FrameRate is invalid.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SPATIAL_SVC_LAYER
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Spatial SVC layer (SVAC decoder only) 0 : base layer picture 1 : enhance layer picture

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SPATIAL_SVC_MODE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Spatial SVC mode (SVAC decoder only) 0 : disable inter-layer prediction, simulcast. 1 : enable inter-layer prediction in which EL picture is predicted with motion vector information from the base layer picture.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SPATIAL_SVC_FLAG
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Spatial SVC flag (SVAC/AV1 decoder only)

ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Temporal ID VP9 : N/A

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PIC_NUM_SKIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The number of skip block in 8x8

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RSVD0
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SECURITY_FLAG
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: security flag (0: non-secure instance / 1: secure instance) - AXI AxProt[1] bit is set to an inverted value.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PRIORITY_VALUE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: priority value (low priority 0~255 high priority)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RC_FRAME_RATE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: A frame rate indicator for rate control For example, the value 30 of frameRateInfo represents 30 frames/sec.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SRC_ADDR_U

ipxact:alternateRegister.ipxact:description: FBC chroma offset base of index 1

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FBC_CHROMA_OFFSET_BASE1
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If FBC is used, this is chroma offset base address of DPB index 1. Otherwise, it is ignored.

ipxact:alternateRegister.ipxact:name: RET_DEC_NOTIFICATION
ipxact:alternateRegister.ipxact:description:
Sequence change flag
If NOTI_FLAG is equal to 1, VPU detects a new sequence. It may require different decoding resources such as DPB size, DPB number, and etc. Otherwise, VPU decodes the subsequent AU of the sequence.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RSVD0
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NOTI_FLAG_DPB_COUNT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If NOTI_FLAG_DPB_COUNT is equal to 1, the current picture needs the different number of DPB.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NOTI_FLAG_BITDEPTH
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If NOTI_FLAG_BITDEPTH is equal to 1, the bitdepth of the currently decoded picture is different from the bitdepth of the previously decoded picture.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NOTI_FLAG_INTER_RES_CHANGE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If NOTI_FLAG_INTER_RES_CHANGE is equal to 1, one DPB needs to be reallocated. (VP9/AV1 decoder only)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NOTI_FLAG_SIZE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If NOTI_FLAG_SIZE is equal to 1, the decoded size of the current picture is different from the size of the previously decoded picture. Otherwise, the decoded size of current picture is equal to the size of previously decoded picture.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NOTI_FLAG_CHROMA_FORMAT_CHANGE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If it is equal to 1, the chroma format (4:2:0 etc.) is different from the chroma format of the previously decoded picture.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RSVD1
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NOTI_FLAG_PROFILE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If NOTI_FLAG_PROFILE is equal to 1, the profile of the current picture is different from the profile of the previously decoded picture. Otherwise, the profile of the current picture is equal to the profile of the previously decoded picture.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RSVD2
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PIC_AVG_CTU_QP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: An average value of CTU QPs

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: USERDATA_FLAG20
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
A flag of user data buffer full.
User data buffer full flag equal to 1 specifies that decoded frame has more user data size than VPU internal buffer. VPU only dumps the internal buffer size of user data to USER_DATA_BUF_BASE buffer. In other words, VPU is unable to report the rest of the user data to USER_DATA_BUF_BASE buffer after the internal buffer fullness happens.

Display top offset
DISPLAY_TOP_OFFSET is equal to leftOffset.
topOffset = conf_win_top_offset + def_disp_win_top_offset.
See Annex E.3 of H.265 specification for more information.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: DISPLAY_BOTTOM_OFFSET

Display bottom offset
DISPLAY_BOTTOM_OFFSET is equal to bottomOffset.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: USE_FORCE_PIC_QP

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RSVD0
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ROTATE_MODE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: [3] - horizontal mirror [2] - vertical mirror [1:0] - 90 degree left rotate 1=90' 2=180' 3=270'

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ROTATE_ENABLE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: It enables or disables rotation.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: COL_BASE2
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Codec dedicated information buffer for encoding/decoding HEVC/AVC: MV COL AV1 : CDF

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: OUTPUT_FLAG
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: H.265/H.264 : a picture output flag VP9 : show_frame If OUTPUT_FLAG is 0, the current decoded picture is not output for display. If OUTPUT_FLAG is 1, the current decoded picture is (will be) output for display. AVS2 : 0 if decoded picture is GB. 1 for other picture types

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: REF_PIC_FLAG
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: H.264 0 : non reference picture 1 : reference picture

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VCL_NAL_UNIT_TYPE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: VCL NAL unit type

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RSVD0
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PIC_TYPE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
H.265/H.264 Each field shows the decoded slices for the picture. If more than one B slice are decoded, it returns 4 with the value of B_SLICE_DECODED[2] equal to 1. If there are all types of slices in a decoded picture, it returns 7. [2] B_SLICE_DECODED [1] P_SLICE_DECODED [0] I_SLICE_DECODED
VP9, 1 : I picture 2 : P picture
AV1 0: KEY FRAME 1: INTER FRAME 2 : INTRA ONLY FRAME 3: SWITCH FRAME
AVS2, 0 : I picture 1 : P picture 2 : B picture 3 : F picture 4 : S picture 5 : G picture 6 : GB picture

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: DIST_Y_LOW
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Low 32bit SSD between source Y picture and reconstructed Y picture

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RESERVED0
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: USE_SRC_LONGTERM_PIC
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: A flag for the current picture to be used as a longterm reference picture later when other picture's encoding

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: CMD_ENC_CSC_COEFF_0
ipxact:register.ipxact:description:
RGB to YUV color space conversion coefficient register Coef and offset values can be freely set through the registers below. However, we guarantee only for the 4 format mentioned below.
Y = ry_coef*R + gy_coef*G + by_coef*B + y offset Cb = rcb_coef*R + rcb_coef*G + gcb_coef*B + cb offset Cr = rcr_coef*R + gcr_coef*G + bcr_coef*B + cr offset

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RSVD0
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CSC_Coeff_RY
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: range : -512 ~511 examples: BT.601 : 10'h0x99 BT.601 Studio Swing : 10'h0x84 BT.709 : 10'h0x6d BT.2020 : 10'h0x87

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CSC_Coeff_GY
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: range : -512 ~511 examples: BT.601 : 10'h0x12d BT.601 Studio Swing : 10'h0x102 BT.709 : 10'h0x16e BT.2020 : 10'h0x15b

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CSC_Coeff_BY
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: range : -512 ~511 examples: BT.601 : 10'h0x3A BT.601 Studio Swing : 10'h0x32 BT.709 : 10'h0x25 BT.2020 : 10'h0x1e

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VUI_RBSP_ADDR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: It specifies the address of VUI RBSP buffer. (Little endian)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CB_BASE4
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Cb base address of DPB index 4 Compressed Cb and Cr base address of DPB index 4

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CRC_LUMA_VAL_0
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The 1st CRC value of display luma frame

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NUMBER_OF_TILE_COLUMNS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The number of tile columns considering tile constraints (both AV1 spec. and hardware) and rotation. (In case of 90 degree rotation, the number of tiles input from CMD_ENC_SEQ_TILE_PARAM need to be adjusted to consider the rotated size. the host can identify the actual number of tiles from this register.)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CSC_Coeff_GCB

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: HRD_RBSP_ADDR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: It specifies the address of HRD RBSP buffer. (Little endian)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CR_BASE4
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Cr base address of DPB index 4

ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Immediate break It forces to stop V-CPU and enter in a debug mode to analyze hang-up situation. V-CPU cannot resume from the break point.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STABLEBRK
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Stable break It is an external break request when V-CPU is in stable (breakable) status.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RESUME
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Resume It resumes from the breakpoint.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STEP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Step It runs V-CPU in step instruction mode.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: VPU_PDBG_IDX_REG
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: V-CPU debugger index register (For debugger only)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RSVD0
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RDDBG
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Read Operation Request RDDBG and WRDBG cannot be 1 at the same time.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: WRDBG
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Write Operation Request RDDBG and WRDBG cannot be 1 at the same time.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: DBGIDX
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Debug Index Debugger Register Index

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: VPU_PDBG_WDATA_REG
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: V-CPU debugger write data register (For debugger only)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VPU_PDBG_WDATA_REG
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
To write data to the debugger,
# Write some data to this register. # Write VCPU_PDBG_IDX_REG with WRDBG as 1 and DBGIDX as this register address. # After writing is completed, VPU_PDBG_WDATA_REG will be cleared.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: VPU_PDBG_RDATA_REG
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: V-CPU debugger read data register (For debugger only)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VPU_PDBG_RDATA_REG
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
To read data to the debugger,
# Write VCPU_PDBG_IDX_REG with RDDBG as 1 and DBGIDX as the register address to be read. # Read from the specified register to this register.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RSVD0
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STEP_MASK_ENABLE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Interrupt Disable at step for debugger
